sentences: Sam John Farrar (born June 29, 1978) is an American musician, singer and record producer.
A frequent collaborator with the band since the 1990s, he joined as a touring member in 2012 and was promoted to an official member in 2016.
A frequent collaborator with the band since the 1990s, he joined as a touring member in 2012 and was promoted to an official member in 2016.
A frequent collaborator with the band since the 1990s, he joined as a touring member in 2012 and was promoted to an official member in 2016.
He has also been the bassist for the rock band Phantom Planet since their formation in 1994.

section: == Musical career == | === 1994–2012: Phantom Planet and other side projects ===

sentences: === 2012–present: Maroon 5

In 2012, Farrar became a touring member of Maroon 5, playing various instruments, including guitars, bass guitar (occasionally), percussion and additional keyboards, singing backing vocals and providing samples and other special effects (using the MPC).

He formerly co-wrote and co-produced a few of the band's songs on almost all of their studio albums and also remixed one of their songs, which is called "Woman", on Call and Response: The Remix Album, released in 2008.
On August 31, 2012 - during a show in Argentina on the Overexposed Tour - Farrar filled-in for Mickey Madden on the bass guitar for the very first time.
After touring with the band as a touring member for the next couple of years, Farrar appeared in an official, promotional photo of Maroon 5 for the first time, in late 2016.
After touring with the band as a touring member for the next couple of years, Farrar appeared in an official, promotional photo of Maroon 5 for the first time, in late 2016.

He is also featured on the cover of the band's sixth studio album, Red Pill Blues (2017) - all of this can be seen as confirmation, that Farrar became an official member of Maroon 5, making them a seven-piece band.

His father, John Farrar, was a member of The Shadows and also carved a successful songwriting career, penning many of Olivia Newton-John's big hits as well as producing nearly every one of her albums during her most successful years.
His mother, Pat Carroll, was a successful Australian pop singer in the 1960s.
Their daughter Vesper Pearl Farrar was born on August 6, 2009 and their son Flynn Roscoe Farrar was born on January 14, 2014.
Their daughter Vesper Pearl Farrar was born on August 6, 2009 and their son Flynn Roscoe Farrar was born on January 14, 2014.
